Seoul : President Park Geun-hye of South Korea has vowed to disband her country 's coast guard , saying South Korea owed reform and a great transformation to hundreds of high school students who died in a ferry disaster last month .

Seoul : President Park Geun-hye of South Korea has vowed to disband her country 's coast guard , saying South Korea owed reform and a great transformation to hundreds of high school students who died in a ferry disaster last month .
Ms Park offered a tearful heartfelt apology for failing to prevent the sinking of the  ferry on April 16 and for the coast guard 's bungling of rescue operations .

The ultimate responsibility of the poor response to this accident lies with me , Ms Park said in an address to the nation on Monday , during which she openly wept and twice bowed deeply before the television cameras in a display of contrition .
Ms Park 's popularity ratings have been hammered by the disaster that claimed about 300 lives .
Ms Park 's popularity ratings have been hammered by the disaster that claimed about 300 lives .
She has voiced regret several times , but Monday 's address was the first time she had explicitly accepted direct responsibility for what has become a defining moment of her presidency .
